meanings.definition: The act of covering the top of something.
meanings.sent1: She placed a capping on the bottle to keep the liquid from spilling.
meanings.sent2: The capping on the chimney prevented rain from entering the house.
meanings.sent3: The capping on the cake made it look like a little hat!
meanings.sent4: The capping of snow on the mountain glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The capping of frosting on the cupcake was perfectly swirled.

meanings.definition: The practice of setting a limit on something.
meanings.sent1: The capping on the number of guests at the party was necessary for safety.
meanings.sent2: The budget capping ensured that expenses stayed within control.
meanings.sent3: The capping on screen time for kids led to creative play with toys.
meanings.sent4: The capping on the speed limit kept drivers safe on the road.
meanings.sent5: The capping on the number of cookies each person could take was fair for all.

meanings.definition: The act of surpassing or outdoing someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her capping of the previous record amazed everyone at the competition.
meanings.sent2: The team's capping of their opponent's score secured their victory.
meanings.sent3: The capping of the rival team's score left them in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: His capping of the sales target set a new company record.
meanings.sent5: The capping of her performance outshined all others on stage.
